conclusion: Analyze forces on points C and D to determine minimum force required.
Weight at point C exerts downward force mg; tension in rope AC (F_T1) acts upwards and left; tension in rope CD (F_T2) acts horizontally right.
Tension in rope CD (F_T2) acts horizontally left; tension in rope BD (F_T3) acts upwards and right; external force F applied horizontally right.
For equilibrium, sum of forces in horizontal and vertical directions must be zero.
Vertical component of F_T1 must balance weight mg: F_T1 sin(θ) = mg.
Horizontal component of F_T1 must balance tension F_T2: F_T1 cos(θ) = F_T2.
Distance between A and B is 2L; ropes AC and BD form right triangles with vertical height L.
From vertical force balance: F_T1 = mg√2.
From horizontal force balance: F_T2 = mg.
Horizontal force F at D must balance F_T2: F = mg√2/2.
Minimum force F required to keep rope CD level is F = √3/2 mg.
